definition: to seal up (a door with a paper seal, or a document)/to confer an additional title on a nobleman
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
surname Feng
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
to confer additional titles on a nobleman

sentences.english: He signed and sealed the document.
The order was sealed with the king's signet.
sentences.chinese: 这一命令是用国王的印记加封的。

sentences.english: Here is tape for sealing it.
Hydrants must be covered by seals on which there are dates and chops from the factory.
sentences.chinese: 消防栓要加封条，封条写上日期加盖工厂公章。

sentences.english: Standard plugs are installed with a washer, which creates a compression seal with the head.
sentences.chinese: 标准插头装置有一个洗衣机，它创建压缩加封头。

sentences.english: The canonization ceremony included some history as well.
sentences.chinese: 加封仪式本身也有着一些历史。

definition: to confer a posthumous title
to receive fief and title/to be enfeoffed/(fig.) to be rewarded by the emperor
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
to appoint sb to a post or confer a title on sb by imperial order
to join the nobility/to rise through the nobility
to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
to give to the departed/to confer (a title) posthumously
to hand down an imperial edict
honorific title during Tang to Qing times, approx. "Glorious grand master"
a rank in government service
tutor to the crown prince (in imperial China)
official ranking/titles and honors
to issue an imperial edict
to promote (sb)/to upgrade/to ascend
posthumous name and title
promotion/to take additional post
